gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem

Class RelationDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.RelationDefinition

  • public class RelationDefinition
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the abstract definition of a relation.

    For example, we can define a Regulation relation, with a single core argument of type Theme and a single optional argument of type Cause. Information about the arguments (such as, what semantic types can fill these roles) are provided by RelationArgument objects.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

                          java.util.List<RelationArgument> optionalArgs)
        Constructs a RelationDefinition object, with a type, relation class, core and optional argument information.
        Parameters:
        type - the short name of the relation
        fullName - the full name of the relation
        relClass - the class that implements relations created by this definition
        coreArgs - the core argument definitions
        optionalArgs - the optional argument definitions

      • argSatisfiesRole

        public boolean argSatisfiesRole(java.lang.String role,
                                SemanticItem arg)
        Checks whether the argument supplied is allowed in the given role. It checks the class and allowed semantic types that the role-filling argument is supposed to have.
        Parameters:
        role - the role given to the argument
        arg - the semantic item argument
        Returns:
        true if the argument is allowed

      • argumentViolatesMultipleRoleConstraint

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> argumentViolatesMultipleRoleConstraint(java.util.List<Argument> args)
        For a given list of arguments, gets the set of roles which do not allow multiple arguments by definition, but have multiple arguments.

        Used for consistency checking in relation composition.

        Parameters:
        args - the list of arguments
        Returns:
        the set of roles for which the argument list does not follow the multiple argument constraint
